discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B and C

Correct answer is BC 

You'll need to remove LD and Intl partitions from device CSS to prevent users to call while authorized users are logged off and to allow authorized users add the partitions to their device profile css to be able to make these calls.

Selected Answer: BC
When a CSS is applied at both the line and phone level, the CUCM will check the call against the line-level CSS first. If the partition of the called number is not in the line-level CSS, then the system will check the phone-level CSS. If neither CSS contains the called partition, then the call will fail.

https://www.globalknowledge.com/us-en/resources/resource-library/articles/understanding-calling-search-space-usage-at-the-phone-and-line-level/#gref

questions.question_text: An administrator discovers that employees are making unauthorized long-distance and international calls from logged-off Extension Mobility phones when the authorized users are away from their desks. Which two configurations should the administrator configure in the Cisco UCM to avoid this issue? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Remove long-distance & international pattern’s partitions from the calling search space of the device profile.
choices.A: Add the long-distance & international pattern’s partitions to the calling search space of the physical phone.
choices.D: Add the long-distance & international pattern’s partitions to the calling search space of the physical phone’s directory number.
choices.C: Add the long-distance & international pattern’s partitions to the calling search space of the device profile.
choices.B: Remove the long-distance & international pattern’s partitions to the calling search space of the physical phone.

choices.A: Use Dialed Number Analyzer to determine if the user extension can dial the mobile phone.
choices.C: Check to make sure that the Resume softkey option appears on the desk phone.
choices.B: Add the mobility key to the softkey template that the desk phone is using.
choices.D: Confirm that the desk phone is subscribed to Cisco Extension Mobility.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Configures a mobility softkey template for Cisco IP Phones that includes the Mobility softkey. Users can transfer calls from their deskphone to a mobile phone by pressing the softkey. 

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/12_5_1SU1/cucm_b_feature-configuration-guide-for-cisco1251SU1/cucm_m_cisco-unified-mobility-1251.html#CUCM_TK_C17557F2_00

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer

questions.question_text: A user’s phone is already configured for Single Number Reach, and the user wants a feature to move an active call from a mobile phone to a desk phone and vice-versa. As an administrator, which additional configuration should be made to fulfill the user’s request?
Single Number Reach calls to a cell phone that not answered are leaving voicemails on the cell phone rather than the corporate mailbox. Which two options will resolve this issue? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
Enable the mobility feature and adjust the voicemail timer

Selected Answer: CE
Going with C and E on this one

choices.A: Check the Enable Extend and Connect checkbox.
choices.B: Check the Enable Unified Mobility features checkbox.
choices.E: Decrease the Answer Too Late timer.

discussion.content:
Answer is correct.

See Provision Mobility Users Through LDAP:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/11_5_1/cucm_b_feature-configuration-guide-cisco1151su8/cucm_b_feature-configuration-guide-cisco1151su8_chapter_01.html#task_77EEACB9BEBA958F465F4CE26BD76D36

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the steps from the left into the order to provision mobility users through LDAP on the right. Not all options are used.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct answer is A

questions.question_text: An administrator configured Cisco Unified Mobility to block access to remote destinations for certain caller IDs. A user reports that a blocked caller was able to reach a remote destination. Which action resolves the issue?
